title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Questions about background and values. Questions about what I like, what I like to do, ppl I like to work with, tasks I like to perform, location able to work at, ability to relocate if needed
Interview Questions:
Strenghts
Weakness
Values
Background
History

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Tulsa
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty straight forward but I have to say I will never apply to TU again.  First, they contact your references before offering an interview.  They request an uploaded LOR before you are even selected to interview. What a waste of time for your references!  

Then they do not disclose the salary until after the interview and what was offered to me was 20k under the comps for my experience.  Don't do it!  They charge so much for tuition and obviously run on very cheap labor.
Interview Questions: What is your relevant experience? How do you like to be managed?

title: Senior Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Held by two people. Asked how comfortable I was with calling people, had to do a practice call during an interview with a script. Was very engaging. Asked for my past experience
Interview Questions: Why should i be hired? What is my past experience? How would I handle objections?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Discussion of previous experiences and project in general overview and then discussion on problem solving and issues face and debug process and describe the scrum meeting with your tech lead and people around and how it helps
Interview Questions: Why did u use the particular platform to solve problem? and follow up on those problems regarding debugging and helping with team mates and discussing with clients about the update of the situation and places

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple and flexible. As a work study, they were open and understanding of my limited experience, and were encouraging about providing any assistance I would need throughout the year.
Interview Questions: What area of the arts would you most enjoy working in?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy, requires you to mock tutor. Talk about flexibility and ability to adapt to numerous tutoring styles and student while maintaining uniqueness. I would be prepared to answer questions about learning style
Interview Questions: What's your biggest trick to use during tutoring?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and was contacted via email with an interview date and time. Then, I was interviewed by a panel of four (4) individuals. All of the individuals were females, and they each took turns asking me questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tulsa
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process is pretty informal. All they really want to know is your previous related experiences. They also value your willingness to learn. There are no any tricky questions. Overall, I will say the interview experience is quite positive.
Interview Questions: How are you familiar with the computer?

title: Full Stack Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and I heard back within 2 weeks. The entire process was lax and simple. Only had 1 interview that was a mix of tech skill and being able to communicate what I have worked on with a manager.
Interview Questions: How to program Merge Sort.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: General questions about previous experience, expertise. This was more of a meeting with various faculty members and administrators of the university and getting to know the people and seeing the teaching environment at the university.
Interview Questions: What makes you come to the University of Tulsa?

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Tulsa
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process consists of a structured interview, and a physical agility test. The Physical agility test consists of a 1.5 mile run in (17.5 minutes), 18 push-ups (not timed), and 20 sit-ups (1 minute). The structured interview consists of approximately 20 questions specific to the security department are are an analysis of the candidate's judgment.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of Command Presence and how does it relate to security?

title: Research Assisatant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tulsa
Interview Descriptions: Very easy - more like a discussion than an interview. I was asked about my research interests, educational background and my previous work experience. All my questions were answered.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tulsa
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was brief and was given an offer for the research position.
Interview Questions: What previous experience prepared you for this job

title: ACA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. One mingle with other students to see how you do, one interview with three management officla.s
Interview Questions: Tell me about your family.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Called and set up interview time. Arrived and met with two professional staff members.  They told all about the office and the job. Then began interview.  Last question: What kind of fruit would you be and why?
Interview Questions: If you could be any kind of fruit what would you be and why?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Found that the position was open on the company website. Applied for the position, as there were few opportunities to move out of current position. Application did not get anywhere until I asked my manager to look into it. Only then was I granted a courtesy interview, even though I was well qualified for the posted position.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to leave the position you currently have?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (Tulsa, OK) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the professor that you are planning on working with. However, I can say in our department it is typically a conference call with all the professors in the room. They asked me questions about my research as an undergrad primarily. Additionally, they asked me questions on what I want my research focus to be in the future.
Interview Questions: They asked questions on my research experience and what my research interests are.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Tulsa (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Questions about background and values. Questions about what I like, what I like to do, ppl I like to work with, tasks I like to perform, location able to work at, ability to relocate if needed
